title: Apply a problem template
content:
You can apply a template to an existing problem. The advantage of a template is that you can add standardized information when a problem meets certain criteria.

Example: A critical problem template can set the business impact, urgency, and more in a new problem.

To apply a template:

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Problem > Problems. Service Management displays a list of all problem records.
  2. Select the problem record that you want to standardize with a template.
  3. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.
  4. Click Apply template on the toolbar. Service Management displays a dialog that contains a list of existing templates.
  5. Select an appropriate template. You can easily locate the required template by typing the template title or description in the Search template search box. This search is case-sensitive and only supports "starts with" queries.
  6. Click Apply template. Service Management populates the fields in the current record with the values from the template fields.
  7. Click Save on the toolbar.

After you apply a template to a record and save the record, there is no further relationship with the template. You can delete the template without affecting the values in the saved record.
